content: If you have a Domestic Violence conviction (not arrest, but conviction), you fall under what is known as the "Lautenberg Act." Felony or Misdemeanor, this act refuses you any right to carry a firearm - as a civilian, in the military, as a police officer, and even as a security guard. You can NEVER be employed in a position that requires a firearm. It's BS. You know it and I know it. But there is no waiver for the Lautenberg Act - period. You're hosed. You can never join any part of the military. It is time to look elsewhere. My prayers and best wished to you. I'll ask God to bless you richly. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
